result.execSummary:
The defendant Kayla M. Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft from a Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.81.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution of $975.00, joint and several with Scott Jones. (01-05-17: Probation is Extended for 2 years, if restitution is not paid by 01-30-17)

Pay cost including the DNA surcharge. 
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Maintain fulltime employment if able or pursue high school diploma.  Pay restitution first before pursuing education.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
No contact with Harold Drewa. 
No contact with Scott Jones except for the purpose of child placement or as approved by the agent.

Only use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescription medications. 
Sign releases so agent can monitor compliance to treating physician and pharmacy. 
Comply with any CHIPS order she is under. 
Participate in any other counseling recommended by the agent.  If additional parenting classes are called for, she is to do those. 
Provide a DNA sample.

AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Agent can accept AODA already received if agent deems appropriate.
Sign releases so agent can review that assessment.

Court reviews the files.

Defendant Kayla M. Clark in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard for sentencing: 14CF129, 14CF300, 14CM130  Status Conference - 14TR2772  Pre-Trial Conference - 14CF413

8:32 a.m.  Court calls the case.  

State moves to dismiss and read in 14TR2772 and 14CF413.
BY THE COURT:  14CF413 and 14TR2772 are dismissed and read-in. 

Court and both counsel have received the PSI. 
Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court re: correction.
Atty Kryshak makes statements to the Court re: correction. 

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
14CF129 Count 7 - 
Serve 6 months jail. STAYED
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years: 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Agent can accept AODA already received if agent deems appropriate.
Sign releases so agent can review that assessment. 
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Only use 1 pharmacy to obtain prescription medications. 
Sign releases so agent can monitor compliance to treating physician and pharmacy. 
Maintain fulltime employment if able or pursue high school diploma.  Pay restitution first before pursuing education.
Comply with any CHIPS order she is under. 
Participate in any other counseling recommended by the agent. If additional parenting classes are called for she is to do those. 
Pay restitution: $975.00 joint and several with Scott Jones. 
Pay DNA surcharge. 
Pay 10% restitution surcharge. 
No contact with Harold Drewa. 
No contact with Scott Jones except for the purpose of child placement or as approved by the agent. 
Pay costs. 
Provide DNA sample.  

14CF300 Count 1 - 
Serve 30 days jail. 
25 days credit. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date and time. 
Allowed to serve half the sentence on home monitor if she qualifies.
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Pay fine of $300 plus costs.  To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan. 
Pay $26.45 blood draw fee. To be paid within 60 days or set up a payment plan.
Court does not order the DNA surcharge based on financial situation. 
Revocation for 12 months. 
IID for 12 months.  Effective immediately. 
Obtain DOT asesssment and comply with safety plan. 

14CF300 Count 3 - 
Serve 30 days jail, consecutive to Count 1. 
Allowed to serve half the sentence on home monitor if she qualifies.
Huber for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date and time. 
Pay fine of $300 plus costs.  Court does not order the DNA surcharge. 
No additional revocation of the license. 

14CF300 Count 5 - 
Serve 30 days jail, consecutive to any other sentence.  STAYED
Placed on probation for 24 months, concurrent:
Same conditions as ordered in 14CF129. 
Pay costs.  Court does not order the DNA surcharge. 

14CM130 Count 1 -

Same conditions as ordered in 14CF129. 
Pay costs.  

14CM130 Count 3 -

Placed on probation for 24 months, concurrent: 
Pay costs.  Court does not order the DNA surcharge. 

BY THE COURT: Any bond posted in any file is to be applied to the restitution/fines/costs.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on February 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kayla M. Clark in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. 
14CF129 Ct 7: W/H Sentence, 24 mo Probation:   AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.   Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.   Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.   Submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge. Pay restitution of $975.00 which is joint/several and 10% restitution surcharge.  Pay costs. Request for PSI report. Cts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, & 6 to be DRI.
14CF300 Cts 1 & 3: 30 day jail sentence w/$300 fine + costs;  & 5: W/H Sentence, Probation. Cts 2, 4, & 6 to be DRI.
14CM130 Ct 1 & 3: W/H Sentence, Probation. Ct 2 to be DRI
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF129 Ct 7: No Contest
14CF300 Cts 1, 3, & 5: No Contest
14CM130 Ct 1 & 3: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  
14CF129 Ct 7:
14CF300 Cts 1, 3, & 5:
14CM130 Ct 1 & 3: Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
---
14CF129 Cts 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, & 6 are dismissed read in. 
14CF300 Cts 2, 4, & 6 are dismissed read in.
14CM130 Ct 2 is dismissed read in.

Court Orders a PSI report and be provided to parties 1 week prior to sentencing.
Bond is continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
